p: SAR has been used for decades by researchers as a cheaper way to develop relationships between physiochemical properties of chemicals and their bioactivities (Santos-Filho et al., 2009; Verma et al., 2010). It is a widely used tool in bioinformatics, drug discovery for clinical research, pharmaceutical industry, petrochemical and agrochemical sectors for modeling and predictive pattern analysis (Alam & Khan, 2017; Fakayode et al., 2014; Funar-Timofei et al., 2017). For further analysis, MLR has been employed. For instance, TPSA (Å 2), molecular weight, XLogP3, H-bond donor count, H-bond acceptor count of the drugs are the most significant variables on QSAR contributors to the MLR model ( Table S3, supporting information ).
